title: Sanders rues 'rough' debut after Gabriel concussed
content: Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders made his NFL debut Sunday against the Ravens, coming on after fellow rookie Dillon Gabriel was concussed.

title: Source: Concern Rodgers has break in left wrist
content: The initial concern is that Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers has "a slight break" in his left wrist, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Mahomes takes blame as division title hopes fade
content: Patrick Mahomes took much of the blame for the Chiefs' 22-19 loss to the Broncos, an outcome that leveled the team's record at 5-5 and put their hopes at winning another AFC West title in doubt.

title: Draymond confronts fan over 'Angel Reese' chant
content: Draymond Green went nearly chest-to-chest with a fan during the Warriors' road game against the New Orleans Pelicans on Sunday night.

title: Sources: Naylor, Mariners reunite on 5-year deal
content: First baseman Josh Naylor and the Mariners are in agreement on a five-year contract, sources told ESPN, reuniting one of the best free agent bats available with the team that made re-signing him its top offseason priority.

title: Ramsey ejected for punch, says Chase spit on him
content: Steelers defensive back Jalen Ramsey was ejected for throwing a punch at Bengals wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase with a little more than 12 minutes remaining in the fourth quarter of Sunday's game.

title: Allen's 6 TDs draw more 'unreal' praise by Bills
content: Josh Allen rebounded from a rough start against the Buccaneers to record three passing touchdowns and a career-high three rushing TDs. It was his second career game with 3 TDs passing and 3 rushing.

title: Bears' Wright honors former coach Beam with INT
content: Playing with a heavy heart Sunday following the death of his former college coach John Beam, Bears cornerback Nahshon Wright recorded an interception in Chicago's 19-17 win at Minnesota, saying afterward that Beam "was behind me today."

title: Eagles roll over Lions: Here's what to know from Week 11, including our main takeaways
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions from each game. Here's what we learned from Week 11.

title: Connelly's 25 favorite games: How they went down and what they mean
content: From A&M's historic comeback to heart-stoppers at all levels, Week 12 was packed with games to remember.

title: Week 11 winners and losers: Allen, McCaffrey dominate; Chase, Jefferson go quiet
content: Josh Allen, Christian McCaffrey and Sean Tucker led the way with big Week 11 performances, while Ja'Marr Chase, Justin Jefferson and Lamar Jackson were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Buzz: Tucker goes off for Buccaneers; Packers lose Jacobs, Ridley's season over
content: Sean Tucker had 140 yards and three TDs in early Sunday action, but injuries were abound again in Week 11.

title: Orlando's NWSL title defense is over, so what's next for Marta?
content: Marta was the best player on the field Sunday, but it wasn't enough to inspire Orlando past Gotham FC.

title: Arsenal, Bayern, Marseille? Lessons learned across Europe's top leagues after 10 games
content: With nearly three months of games being played across the continent, what has stuck out the most from the major European leagues?

title: 2026 World Cup: Ukraine keep World Cup hopes alive with clinched playoff spot
content: The race to qualify for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is drawing to a close. Here's how it's looking around the globe.

title: Reyna takes advantage of opportunity in return, as USMNT continues unbeaten run
content: Gio Reyna had a chance to redeem himself and make it to the USMNT's World Cup squad next year and he took full advantage in its 2-1 win against Paraguay.

title: Grant breezes to second LPGA title at The Annika
content: Linn Grant closed with a 5-under 65 on Sunday for a three-shot victory over Jennifer Kupcho in The Annika. It was Grant's second LPGA title, and the second time she received a trophy from Swedish great and tournament host Annika Sorenstam.

title: What's next for Makhachev, Shevchenko and other stars from UFC 322?
content: Brett Okamoto breaks down the options for Islam Makhachev, Valentina Shevchenko, and more after UFC 322.

title: Draft risers, questions and notes: How does this WR class stack up?
content: We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 12, including why Zachariah Branch and Makai Lemon are intriguing prospects.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona, Bayern, Man United fight for Vlahovic
content: Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic has Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Manchester United, Tottenham Hotspur and Atlético Madrid on his trail. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Sheikh Hasina Verdict Live:Bangladesh In Alert Ahead Of Verdict Against Ex-PM
content: Sheikh Hasina's Crimes Against Humanity Verdict LIVE Updates: Bangladesh has heightened security across Dhaka and other areas amid sporadic violence ahead of the special tribunal's highly anticipated Monday verdict against former PM Sheikh Hasian.

title: "I Don't Care. Allah Gave Life, He Will Take It": Hasina Before Big Verdict
content: Ahead of a Bangladesh court's verdict on the alleged crimes against humanity committed during her tenure, the country's former Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, has said the allegations against her were false and that she did not care about such verdict

title: Haunted By His Injury, South Korean President Targets 'Workplaces Of Death'
content: Haunted by his own injuries as a child labourer, South Korea's new President Lee Jae Myung has vowed to lower the country's above-average rate of industrial accidents in what he calls "workplaces of death."

title: Fake Nandini Ghee Racket Busted In Bengaluru, Probe On For Animal Fat Use
content: Nandini, one of South India's most trusted dairy brands, has a massive market demand, which the accused exploited by preparing adulterated ghee and passing it off as genuine.

title: "Deeply Distressed": Sheikh Hasina Slams Yunus Over Attacks On Hindus In Bangladesh
content: The interim government under Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus actively sanctioned the assaults against minorities, especially Hindus, forcing them to displace and flee, said former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

title: Man Harasses Woman Walking Her Dog In Bengaluru, Then Flees With Her Phone
content: A late-night walk turned distressing for a woman in Bengaluru after an unidentified man allegedly harassed her and fled with her mobile phone.

title: "Have Nothing To Hide": Trump Urges House Republicans To Release Epstein Files
content: President Donald Trump said House Republicans should vote to release files involving the Jeffrey Epstein case, a startling reversal after previously fighting the proposal.

title: "Will Probably Sentence Her To Death": Sheikh Hasina's Son Ahead Of Court Verdict
content: Sajeeb Wazed's remarks came a day before a Dhaka court was due to deliver a televised verdict that is expected to convict Sheikh Hasina, 78, in absentia on charges of crimes against humanity for a deadly crackdown on student-led protests in 2024.

title: "Grateful To India": Sheikh Hasina To NDTV On Living In Delhi After Ouster
content: Sheikh Hasina said India and Bangladesh's relationship is rooted in "deep respect" for sovereignty and shared regional interests.

title: Delhi's Air Quality Turns 'Severe' As AQI Reading Soars To 427
content: The national capital woke up to dense smog on Monday morning as the average Air Quality Index (AQI) stood at 359 at 7 am, falling under the 'very poor' category despite the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP)-III in effect across Delhi-NCR.

title: "Won't Blackmail Congress By Threatening To Resign": DK Shivakumar
content: Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar on Sunday dismissed rumours of his resignation as the Congress Karnataka unit chief, saying he is a "disciplined soldier" of the party.

title: "Attempt To Erase Legacy": Sheikh Hasina On Father's House Being Vandalised
content: Ex-Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina believes legacy lies not in places or physical objects, but in the values.

title: US Deploys Most Advanced Aircraft Carrier, USS Gerald R Ford, In Caribbean
content: The nation's most advanced aircraft carrier arrived in the Caribbean Sea on Sunday in a display of US military power, raising questions about what the new influx of troops could signal for the Trump administration's intentions in South America

title: National Guards Begin Withdrawal From Chicago, Portland After Legal Setbacks
content: Hundreds of National Guard troops sent to Chicago and Portland began to withdraw Sunday, US media reported, after the deployment by President Donald Trump faced legal setbacks.

title: Was US Involved In Sheikh Hasina's Ouster From Bangladesh? What She Told NDTV
content: Bangladesh's interim chief, Muhammad Yunus, was once admired in American political circles, but the dismantling of the country's democratic infrastructure under his rule has impacted his popularity amongst Western liberals, Sheikh Hasina said.

title: "Painful To Leave My Homeland": Sheikh Hasina To NDTV On Bangladesh Ouster
content: Sheikh Hasina recounts the chaos of her August 5 ouster, the destruction of her family's historic home, and what she describes as a state-sanctioned assault on minorities and democracy.

title: Rohini Acharya vs Tejashwi Yadav: The Crisis Of Dynastic Politics In Bihar
content: In the waning light of a summer that once promised prosperity, Lalu Prasad Yadav finds himself in a twilight of his own making, echoing with the poignant shadows of history.

title: 'Shoot Those Who Show Intent To Kill': Dhaka Preps For Sheikh Hasina Order
content: Security is tightened across Bangladesh with police in the national capital ordered to shoot violent protesters ahead of a special tribunal's verdict against deposed prime minister Sheikh Hasina over alleged crimes against humanity.

title: Delhi Blast Highlights: Anti-Terror Agency Arrests Delhi Suicide Bomber's Accomplice
content: It has been nearly a week since the blast near the Red Fort in Delhi killed 13 people and injured many others. The explosion happened at 6.52 pm on Monday in a white coloured Hyundai i20 driven by a Kashmiri doctor, Umar Mohammad, alias Umar Nabi.

title: PM Modi Visits Under-Construction Surat Bullet Train Station In Gujarat
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday visited the under-construction Bullet Train Station at Surat in Gujarat on Saturday and reviewed the progress of the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High-Speed Rail Corridor.

title: Lalu pari-war: After Rohini, 3 more daughters walk out of Patna home
content: A bitter family feud has erupted within Lalu Prasad's family, with daughter Rohini Acharya alleging humiliation and abuse from her brother Tejashwi Yadav and his associates after donating a kidney to her father. The fallout intensified as three more sisters left their parents' home, while Tej Pratap Yadav voiced support for Rohini, accusing 'betrayers' of targeting the family.

title: Over 40 Indians feared dead in Saudi: Mecca-bound bus collides with diesel tanker
content: More than 40 Indian Umrah pilgrims, many from Hyderabad, are feared dead after a bus collided with a diesel tanker in Saudi Arabia early Monday. Telangana chief minister Revanth Reddy has sought a full report and directed senior officials to coordinate with the Ministry of External Affairs and Saudi authorities. The bus was travelling from Mecca to Medina when the crash occurred, with many passengers reportedly asleep. Rescue efforts are underway, and the Telangana government has set up a control room to assist families. The Indian Consulate in Jeddah has also activated a 24x7 helpline.Helpline (toll free): 8002440003

title: From Gukesh to R Pragg: Early WC exits expose harsh truths
content: Russian Grandmaster Daniil Dubov's dismissive comments after defeating R Praggnanandhaa highlight a trend of early exits for elite players at the FIDE World Cup 2025. Several top seeds, including World Champion D Gukesh, fell to lower-rated opponents, prompting discussions about the narrowing gap in skill and flaws in the rating system.

title: Delhi records best November 1–15 air quality in 3 years — still not worth inhaling
content: Delhi experienced its lowest average AQI in three years during the first fortnight of November, registering at 348. This improvement, despite remaining in the 'very poor' category, is attributed to an early Diwali, reduced stubble burning, better weather, and water sprinkling near monitoring stations.

title: ‘Time for change’: Tesla bull calls for Apple shake-up; urges scrapping Siri
content: Prominent investor Ross Gerber is urging Apple to replace CEO Tim Cook and integrate Google's Gemini AI, suggesting a strategic partnership to enhance Apple's competitive edge in the AI era. Gerber believes this collaboration is 'destiny' and advocates for replacing Siri with Gemini.

title: 'Demons or no demons?': Kumble, Steyn blast Eden pitch; Gambhir defends 3-day shocker
content: A fierce debate surrounds the Eden Gardens pitch after India's Test defeat to South Africa. Coach Gautam Gambhir insists the surface was fair, testing technique and temperament. However, legends Anil Kumble and Dale Steyn strongly disagree, calling the wicket treacherous and unplayable. This controversy highlights India's recent struggles on turning tracks.

title: French consulate staffer molested while walking home in Bandra
content: A 27-year-old French individual became the victim of an alarming molestation incident by a scooter rider on the streets of Bandra West. On November 8th, the unfortunate event spurred a police investigation that culminated in the arrest of 25-year-old Sunil Waghela, a trader from Dharavi.

title: Bangladesh on edge ahead of Hasina verdict: Multiple crude bombs explode in Dhaka
content: Bangladesh braces for a verdict in a case against former PM Sheikh Hasina, facing charges of crimes against humanity. The capital, Dhaka, experienced crude bomb explosions and arson attacks, heightening tensions. Security forces are on high alert ahead of the International Crimes Tribunal's judgment, with prosecutors seeking the death penalty for Hasina, who denies all allegations.

title: Nvidia CEO’s childhood: Mother taught him English; Gave him ‘life-long work’ wisdom
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang revealed a profound life lesson from his mother: she taught him English despite not speaking it herself. This determined approach, using just a dictionary and paper, shaped his 'how hard can it be?' mindset at the chip giant.

title: Nithari murders without murderers: The Surinder Koli saga isn’t over
content: The Nithari case, involving Moninder Singh Pandher and Surinder Koli, saw chilling allegations of murder and rape. Decades of legal battles, marked by flawed investigations and contested confessions, culminated in acquittals for both men. The Supreme Court's final ruling highlighted systemic failures in evidence collection and due process.

title: No real evidence against me, says Sheikh Hasina ahead of crucial verdict
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina urged India to press Dhaka to respect democratic norms and not disenfranchise millions ahead of elections. Facing a special tribunal verdict on alleged crimes against humanity, Hasina denied charges and accused interim leader Yunus of misgovernance, sectarianism, and hostility towards India.

title: IND vs SA: Gill discharged from hospital; concern over fitness for 2nd Test
content: India's Test captain Shubman Gill has been discharged from hospital after a neck spasm ruled him out of the first Test against South Africa. His absence significantly impacted India's batting collapse, leading to a 30-run defeat. Gill's availability for the second Test remains uncertain, with doctors advising against air travel, raising concerns about India's batting lineup.

title: Chat on WhatsApp instantly: Steps to text unsaved numbers; no new contact required
content: WhatsApp allows users to initiate chats without saving contacts by using Click to Chat links or the official "Chat on WhatsApp" button. This feature streamlines communication for temporary interactions and business inquiries, offering flexibility on both mobile and web platforms. Users can create custom links with pre-filled messages for added convenience.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens flat; BSE Sensex crosses 84,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 25,900, BSE Sensex crossed 84,600.

title: IND vs SA — 'Go back to classic Indian pitches': Gambhir gets advice after Kolkata Test defeat
content: Following India's Test loss to South Africa, former batter Wasim Jaffer advised coach Gautam Gambhir to revert to traditional Indian pitches. Critics, including Michael Vaughan and Anil Kumble, questioned the Kolkata pitch's suitability, which heavily favored spin. Gambhir, however, defended the track, stating it was prepared as per the team's request.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Woman harassed while walking dog, phone snatched; police launch hunt
content: A young advocate in Bengaluru was sexually harassed and had her phone stolen by an unidentified man while walking her dog. The incident occurred late at night in Jnanabarathi. The man allegedly approached her under the guise of petting her dog, then made unwanted advances. During a struggle, her phone was snatched as she screamed for help.

title: 'Nothing to hide': Trump backs release of Epstein files, calls controversy a ‘Democrat hoax’
content: US President Donald Trump has reversed his stance, now urging House Republicans to release classified files connected to Jeffrey Epstein, calling the controversy a "Democrat hoax." This shift follows mounting pressure and internal Republican division over the scandal. Trump denies any attempts to block the release of potentially damaging information.

title: Vote share giants, seat share dwarfs: RJD's stunning Bihar polls paradox - explained
content: Bihar's 2025 election saw the RJD secure the highest vote share but a drastically low seat tally, while the NDA achieved a landslide victory. The RJD's votes were spread thinly, resulting in many second-place finishes, a consequence of India's 'First Past the Post' system. The NDA's strategic alliances and efficient vote conversion led to their dominant win.

title: An umpire's error? Why India A's relay catch against Pakistan Shaheens ruled out
content: A controversial relay catch in the India A vs. Pakistan A match saw Maaz Sadaqat survive a dismissal due to a recent MCC rule change. Nehal Wadhera's airborne flick back into play, followed by Naman Dhir's catch, was ruled not out as Wadhera landed outside the boundary. This decision aided Pakistan A's eight-wicket victory, securing their semi-final spot.

title: Bihar elections: Nitish set to take oath as CM on Nov 20; last cabinet meet today
content: Nitish Kumar is set to be sworn in as Bihar Chief Minister for the 10th time on Thursday, November 20, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi expected to attend. Preparations are underway at Gandhi Maidan for the grand event, which will see the formation of a new NDA government including JD(U), BJP, LJP (RV), HAM-S, and RLM.

title: Congo mine bridge collapse: At least 32 killed after overcrowding - video
content: Tragedy struck southeastern Congo as a bridge at the Kalando copper and cobalt mine collapsed, claiming at least 32 lives. Illegal miners, defying warnings of heavy rain and landslides, were on the overcrowded structure when it gave way. Reports suggest panic ensued after soldiers fired shots, leading to the fatal crush.

title: Spirit of cricket: India & Pakistan blind teams shake hands after world cup clash - watch
content: India secured an eight-wicket victory over Pakistan in the Women's T20 World Cup for the Blind, successfully chasing 136 in 10 overs. This win marked India's fifth consecutive triumph and secured their semifinal qualification. Notably, players from both sides exchanged handshakes and shared a bus, fostering goodwill despite broader bilateral tensions.

title: Does plucking one grey hair make more grow? Doctor answers
content: We’ve all been there – staring in the mirror, carefully reaching for the silver strand glistening under the bathroom light, trying to pluck it. Dermatologist debunks the myth that plucking one grey hair leads to ten more. She explains that each hair follicle is independent and cannot trigger surrounding ones to produce more grey hairs. However, plucking can damage the follicle, potentially preventing hair from growing back at all.

title: Kayla Nicole accused of using AI for apology as fans analyse her statement
content: Kayla Nicole faces renewed online backlash over decade-old offensive tweets. Her subsequent apology has ignited a debate, with accusations of using AI to craft her statement. Critics question the sincerity of her remorse, while others argue the focus should be on her growth and acknowledging past harm, not AI detection.

title: ‘The Fate of Ophelia’ sparks theories: Taylor Swift revisits her Joe Alwyn breakup
content: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Toronto in talks to land Cubs’ $460 million standout as blockbuster trade looms
content: The Toronto Blue Jays are reportedly frontrunners to acquire elite two-way outfielder Kyle Tucker from the Houston Astros. This blockbuster move could significantly boost Toronto's championship aspirations by adding a consistent, game-changing bat to their lineup. The trade would address Houston's payroll constraints while providing them with valuable young talent for the future.

title: 'I have also been through this': Chirag Paswan reacts to Rohini's exit from Yadav family
content: RJD leader Rohini Acharya announced her exit from politics, citing family humiliation and abuse, including an alleged threat of physical violence from her brother Tejashwi Yadav. Lok Janshakti Party's Chirag Paswan expressed sympathy, relating to her personal crisis. This public fallout follows the RJD's significant electoral defeat.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for the week starting Nov 17 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal highlights Ashok Leyland and Jindal Stainless as top stock picks for the week. Ashok Leyland's strong Q2 performance, driven by improved mix and cost control, fuels its growth. Jindal Stainless is poised for expansion with a focus on value-added products and sustainability initiatives, capitalizing on rising demand.

title: Aaron Rodgers injury update: Will Steelers’ QB miss Week 12 vs Bears?
content: Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers sustained a left wrist fracture during a game. Initial tests show a small break, offering some relief. Further scans are scheduled for Monday to determine the exact recovery timeline. Mason Rudolph is expected to start in Rodgers' absence. This injury casts doubt on Rodgers' return to Soldier Field.

title: Delhi car blast: Red Fort bomber seen on cam at India Gate, Kartavya Path
content: Investigators have mapped bomber Umar Un Nabi's movements using over 1,300 CCTV cameras, tracing his i20 from Faridabad to Delhi-NCR and back. The car was captured near sensitive locations like Kartavya Path and India Gate before the Red Fort blast. Nabi assembled IEDs in Nuh, receiving instructions from handlers abroad.

title: Rising Stars Asia Cup: PAK steamroll IND in 137-run chase; Suryavanshi’s fight in vain
content: Pakistan Shaheens decisively defeated India A by eight wickets in the Rising Stars Asia Cup. Chasing a modest 137, the Shaheens reached the target in just 13.2 overs, thanks to an outstanding unbeaten 79 from Maaz Sadaqat. India A's innings faltered after a promising start, with Shahid Aziz taking three wickets for the victors.

title: 9 reasons why you wake up hungry and what they mean
content: Waking up hungry can signal an imbalance in your routine or health. Factors like late-night eating, poor sleep, hormonal shifts, medications, and even dehydration can disrupt hunger cues. Understanding these common causes, from PMS to stress, is key to managing nighttime cravings and ensuring restful sleep. Lifestyle adjustments often provide relief, but persistent hunger warrants medical attention.

title: Esophageal cancer vs GERD: Symptoms, causes, and key differences
content: Heartburn, a common ailment, can sometimes signal Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD). While GERD is manageable, persistent symptoms like difficulty swallowing or unexplained weight loss warrant medical attention, as they could indicate a more serious condition like esophageal cancer. Understanding the subtle differences in symptom patterns is crucial for timely diagnosis and treatment.

title: Joy Taylor responds to Young Thug’s viral comment
content: Joy Taylor humorously responded to critics after rapper Young Thug announced his girlfriend's pregnancy. Taylor had previously spoken on her podcast about not wanting children and rejecting assumptions about motherhood. The viral moment brought her comments back into the spotlight. She stood firm on her personal choices regarding reproduction and family planning. Her reaction highlighted her clear boundaries.

title: Jeffrey Epstein’s brother reveals ‘Bubba’ is not Bill Clinton, it is…
content: Mark Epstein clarified that 'Bubba' in a leaked email wasn't Bill Clinton, calling it a private joke.  However, other released emails suggest Donald Trump knew about underage girls and spent time with a victim at Epstein's home, sparking calls for further investigation and White House denials.

title: Saudi Arabia bus crash: Many Indian pilgrims feared dead
content: Reportedly several residents from Hyderabad were on the bus that was travelling from Mecca to Madina, according to the Telangana CMO.

title: Kerala local body polls: A decade of turmoil and defections for Koothattukulam municipality
content: Koothattukulam has had six different chairpersons, including two in the just-concluded term, in the 10 years since it was elevated to a municipality. All three fronts are busy finalising their candidates, hoping to bring in some stability

title: Delhi air pollution LIVE: Supreme Court to hear plea on stubble burning
content: The court had earlier asked the Punjab and Haryana governments to apprise it about the action taken to control the situation

title: Kerala local body polls: RMP strives to retain Left party tag remaining as UDF ‘associate’
content: Party is planning to field its candidates in more seats in the 2025 local body polls. Political rivals say the number of grama panchayat members belonging to the RMP has been declining in its birthplace, Onchiyam

title: Kerala local body polls: NCP factions seek to reinvent their roles in State
content: After the recent split, NCP-SP remains with the LDF; but the NCP, a constituent of the NDA in Maharashtra, is knocking on every door except that of the BJP. In 2021, the unified party notched up a modest 0.99% vote share and the  factions are unsure how much of that will follow them into the polling booths this time

title: Kerala local body polls: JD(S), RJD to have a say in LDF prospects
content: These parties ability to influence close contests makes their position more than just symbolic for the broader Left alliance.  As the elections approach, how CPI(M) manages the demands of smaller allies will be critical to maintaining coalition unity and will be key factors to watch for the LDF’s electoral prospects in the 2026 Assembly polls as well

title: An uncertain solar-powered future
content: In the wake of India’s rapid push towards clean energy, upcoming solar power projects along the West Bengal-Jharkhand border have stirred up protests by thousands in both States. Moyurie Som reports on those who believe it’ll lead to an erasure of their livelihoods and access to their primary source of nutrition — fishing

title: Vellore Corporation lays concrete carriageway without relocating electrical poles
content: Tangedco officials said that relocation of electrical poles is done based on the total number of consumers, who would be affected due to power cuts and the type of transmission power lines such as High Tension (HT) and Low Tension (LT).

title: PMK to hold protests against T.N. govt. over caste census issue
content: The party’s senior leaders said the constituency in charges have been asked to ensure a certain number of PMK cadres are arrested in every police station in their constituency.

title: Anna’s speech still relevant about Delhi rulers, says Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin, who spent more than two hours at the Progressive Book Fair organised by the party’s youth wing leader and Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin in Chennai, said he admired Anna’s speeches.

title: Red Fort blast: agencies to recreate ‘bomber’s’ route, probing hawala trail
content: Umar ul Nabi spent ₹3 lakh on fertilizer purchases, say investigators; police tracking owners, drivers of vehicles that were parked near his car; details of Kashmiri students in Haryana, Meerut sought to check if the accused was in touch with them

title: Govt promised to replace stones with laptops, but Kashmiri youth pushed to become suicide bomber: Mehbooba
content: Ms. Mufti urges Kashmiri youth to shun the path of violence and destruction; calls on Centre to rethink its policies, revisit former PM Atal Behari Vajpayee’s roadmap for Kashmir

title: Preliminary probe into BLO’s death finds no evidence of work pressure: Collector
content: During a review of his responsibilities in the Special Intensive Revision process, officials noted that George had distributed most enumeration forms and showed no signs of work-related pressure.

title: Jaishankar to meet Russian counterpart Lavrov to discuss bilateral ties
content: The External Affairs Minister will lead the Indian delegation at the meeting of Council of Prime Ministers of the SCO on November 18

title: DMK government failed to retain investments coming to T.N., alleges Nainar Nagenthran
content: He says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin must recognise that the State government’s “inefficiency” has resulted in the loss of 20,000 direct employment opportunities that were intended for the State’s youth

title: Son allegedly held for questioning, man attempts self-immolation in Kashmir
content: Bilal Ahmad Wani, a dry fruit seller by profession, was rushed to the Government Medical College, Anantnag after suffering “severe burn injuries”, officials said; the doctors said he was “responding to the treatment”

title: Karnataka Chief Minister’s visit to Delhi on October 17 kindles hope among Cabinet aspirants
content: Amid talk over a Cabinet reshuffle in Karnataka, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is likely to meet All India Congress Committee president Mallikarjun Kharge in Delhi on Monday to discuss the ministerial reshuffle

title: Hyderabad Metro Rail Phase-II hits a wall of clearances, turns into a waiting game
content: Phase-II unable to move forward with key committees yet to meet and vital documents pending; Centre’s approvals, funding clarity and a proper detailed project report are still missing

title: Media with its objectivity and fairness should be a partner in nation-building: Vice President Radhakrishnan
content: Telangana Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy termed the Ramoji Film City as the fourth wonder of Hyderabad and said that the State government would extend all support to sustain the legacy of the “Ramoji” brand in various sectors, mainly journalism and the promotion of the state-of-the-art Ramoji Film City, which has emerged as the hub of film-making in the world

title: Alleged suicide of “disenchanted” workers dog BJP in run-up to local body polls in Kerala
content: RSS worker ends life citing denial of ticket for local body polls, while a councillor in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation dies by suicide after a cooperative society incurred heavy debt. A Mahila Morcha leader allegedly attempted suicide accusing the RSS of derailing her electoral chances by ‘orchestrating’ a smear campaign

title: EAM Jaishankar meets Qatar’s top leadership, discusses bilateral ties, global issues
content: “Reviewed key aspects of our Strategic Partnership including energy, trade, investment and people to people connect. Appreciate the exchange of views on Middle East/West Asia, regional and global developments,” S. Jaishankar said.

title: 98% of supply restored, claims KWA a week after tank collapse in Kochi
content: The drinking water supply to 30% of areas within the Kochi Corporation and nearby local bodies was affected after the sidewall of one of the chambers of the twin-chambered storage tank of the KWA collapsed

title: Trinamool accuses BJP of ‘anti-Bengali mindset’ over remarks on Raja Ram Mohan Roy
content: Comments by BJP leaders on Bengal and its icons have repeatedly sparked controversy, giving the Trinamool Congress a platform to accuse the party of being ‘anti-Bengali’

title: Kalpathy festival wraps up with chariot convergence
content: The chariots of four temples – the Sree Visalakshi Sameta Viswanatha Swamy temple at Kalpathy, the Mandakkarai Sree Maha Ganapathy temple at New Kalpathy, the Sree Lakshmi Narayana Perumal temple at Old Kalpathy, and the Sree Prasanna Maha Ganapathy temple at Chathapuram – meet at Therumutty

title: Muslim forum stresses need for dialogue, collaboration to promote social healing, reduce misunderstanding
content: Association of Muslim Professionals (AMP) conducted a national NGO conference in Lucknow which concluded on Sunday (November 16, 2025) with multiple brainstorming sessions

title: Aluva’s Oppositionleader a ‘surprise pick’ in Cong. list
content: Ghiles Devassy Payyappilly, who won as a CPI(M)-backed independent in 2020, will be the Congress candidate in Thottakkattukara (ward 24)

title: 27 lakh MGNREGA workers deleted between October 10 and November 14
content: High rate of deletions coincides with the Centre’s push for an e-KYC process to weed out ineligible workers; the government denies any correlation, insists deletions are part of a continuous verification process

title: Tamil Nadu pushes for faster expansion of airports to match its economic surge
content: Passenger traffic is rising sharply, new industrial clusters are coming up across the State with a boom in distributed growth, and yet several completed or near-ready airports are waiting for timely operational clearance, points out Minister for Industries T.R.B. Rajaa

title: Constitution a living expression of India’s collective spirit, says Andhra Pradesh High Court Chief Justice
content: Justice Dhiraj Singh Thakur highlights the Constitution’s evolving relevance, as CJI Gavai and Chief Minister Naidu reflect on its role in shaping modern India

title: Kavital Police Station in Karnataka selected as the best among three in country
content: Parameters include response to complainants by women, the general public and aggrieved persons, prevention of atrocities against children and child marriages, and maintaining a good environment, and basic amenities

title: Fort Kochi cries for upkeep despite Kochi being listed among the top 10 global trending destinations
content: Multiple schemes announced by the State government in recent years to restore the Fort Kochi beach, which once saw the footprints of traders from across the world and three colonial powers, remain non-starters

title: P.V. Anvar scrambles for alliance as local body polls near
content: Amid Anvar’s efforts to negotiate seat-sharing arrangements, his party’s leadership criticises his approach and threatens to distance itself from both the UDF and LDF. Anvar warns the IUML of exposing sensitive information if attacks on him persist.

title: RTC engaging with RWAs, residents of new colonies to explore possibility of new routes
content: The TGSRTC is urging residents to contact either the respective regional managers or depot managers to communicate their route requests and “Dial-your-officer” programmes are also being planned. The Corporation has requested RWA office bearers, and individuals have to contact concerned officials with the requirements

title: Union Home Minister Shah responds to CPI(M) leader John Brittas’ letter in Malayalam
content: Brittas’ letter flagged the legal flaws in the Home Ministry’s directive to cancel the OCI registration of a person charge-sheeted for an offence punishable with a sentence of seven years or more

title: Cong. announces 37 candidates in Thrikkakara
content: Candidates include a ‘CPI(M) rebel’, two DCC secretaries, and a block president; four mandalam presidents, including former municipal chairperson Ajitha Thankappan, find a place in the list, while outgoing chairperson Radhamani Pillai has been left out; in all, the list features 17 women

title: Article 32 enables every citizen to approach Supreme Court for enforcement of fundamental rights, says CJI
content: Justice Gavai recalls Ambedkar’s vision behind Article 32 and underscores the need to view the Constitution as a living, evolving document, noting that remedies for rights and the pursuit of social and economic equality were central to Ambedkar’s thinking

title: RSS route march held in Chittapur amid massive security deployment
content: The issue of taking out the march went to the High Court after permission was initially denied to it by the authorities

title: India strengthens eastern defences with three new garrisons near Siliguri ‘Chicken’s Neck’
content: Lachit Borphukan station in Assam and forward bases at Kishanganj and Chopra to bolster surveillance, readiness and coordination with BSF

title: Ashok confident of BJP-JD(S) combine securing 2/3 majority if mid-term polls are held in Karnataka
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Assembly R. Ashok, who did not rule out Karnataka facing mid-term polls amid a struggle for power in the ruling Congress, expressed confidence of the BJP-JD(S) combine securing a two-thirds majority if the elections are held

title: Annual pilgrimage season at Sabarimala begins
content: Pilgrims who had begun gathering at Pampa since Saturday were allowed to trek to the hilltop from Sunday afternoon. Arrangements have been made to accommodate over 80 lakh visitors for the two-month season

title: Sabarimala season: Sathram traditional route to open on Monday
content: Pilgrims from Sathram will be able to access the traditional forest path from 7 a.m.; entry is allowed from 7 a.m. to 1 p.m

title: SIT summons Y.V. Subba Reddy aide  in TTD ghee adulteration case
content: Already under judicial remand, Appanna faces five days of SIT interrogation as investigators probe his alleged role in the adulterated ghee supply to TTD and the receipt of ₹50 lakh in hawala kickbacks

title: A.P. interested in collaborating with South Korea’s LG AI Research for India’s first AI University project in Amaravati
content: Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu discusses plan with to top LG official at CII Partnership Summit in Visakhapatnam on Saturday; LG AI Research is an AI think tank for the entire LG Group with 16 affiliates including LG Chem and LG Electronics

title: Bigg Boss Kannada 12 studio agrees to pay penalty, comply with KSPCB norms
content: Bengaluru South district authorities had removed the seal, placed by KSPCB, on the studio on October 9 following intervention of Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar

title: CII Summit to spur investment, jobs in North Andhra, says MSME Minister
content: Kondapalli Srinivas says new food processing and steel projects will boost local employment; ₹13 lakh crore investment proposals mark a major step toward balanced regional development

title: Hyderabad NGO launches affordable ICU services
content: Unicorpus Health Foundation marked its 10th anniversary by launching an affordable ICU at the Unicorpus Word and Deed Hospital in Pedda Amberpet, Hayathnagar

title: Special Intensive Revision keeps party men, officials and electorates on tenterhooks
content: Even Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has expressed his fear about voters being left clueless on how to fill the complicated SIR enumeration forms issued by the Booth Level Officers (BLOs)

title: Karnataka launches Digital Nagarik programme in govt. schools to enhance cybersecurity awareness among children
content: As part of the initiative, the Department of State Educational Research and Training (DSERT) will initially train 1,00,000 teachers using the DISHA portal

title: Explosion near Red Fort was car-borne suicide attack, says NIA
content: It is the first such incident in Delhi, says NIA, which is ‘continuing its probe across several States’; aide of car bomber held; J&K Police say they have stepped up checks with car and fertilizer dealers, especially those who deal with ammonium nitrate, in Kashmir;

title: Will your team make the playoffs? Simulate the rest of the regular season
content: Loading Playoff Seeds 1st Seed Denver Proj:   9-2 7th Seed Jacksonville Proj:   6-4 2nd Seed New England Proj:   9-2 6th Seed Los Angeles Proj:   7-4 3rd Seed Indianapolis Proj:   8-2 5th Seed Buffalo Proj:   7-3 4th Seed Pittsburgh Proj:   6-4 1st Seed Philadelphia Proj:   8-2 7th Seed San Francisco Proj:   7-4 2nd Seed Los Angeles Proj:   8-2 6th Seed Green Bay Proj:   6-3-1 3rd Seed Chicago Proj:   7-3 5th Seed Seattle Proj:   7-3 4th Seed Tampa Bay Proj:   6-4 See what the latest playoff picture looks like and simulate your own playoff scenarios! Share your scenario:  Tiebreaking Procedures »

title: In Skaggs court case, Angels' challenges mount
content: the wrongful death lawsuit against the los Angeles Angels continues to focus on the team's handling of Kay's drug addiction treatment and whether officials did enough to protect Skaggs . witnesses testified that Kay distributed more than 600 opioid pills to Kay over several years before learning how addictive the pills .

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 11: MVP for Josh Allen? Sack record for Myles Garrett?
content: the Chiefs and the Broncos outlast the Buccaneers at home behind Allen's six touchdowns . it was 6-6 at halftime -- two field goals apiece, nothing to indicate which way it would go . they ended up delivering a classic rivalry game that turned on a sack by Ja'Quan McMillian .

title: Projecting Tuesday's CFP top 12: Where do the Sooners and Tide land?
content: the college football playoff selection committee's third ranking is guaranteed to look different Tuesday night . the biggest question is how the two-loss teams will stack up . assuming the committee rewards Oklahoma's head-to-head win against the Tide, the duo will likely be a package deal .

title: Intel: Could Elee flip? Texas A&M and Miami making moves
content: atop the 2026 class, multiple programs are stepping up their efforts to flip five-star Maryland defensive end commit Zion Elee . Miami , Ohio State , Ole Miss and Texas A&M are each set to host coveted flip targets in week 12 . the market, led by Penn State decommit Davion Brown, is bubbling .

title: The SEC offered a dose of playoff football in Week 12
content: the 2025 season has been more bluster than reality . the balance of power seems to sway like an LSU fan after a 12-hour tailgate . it's the perfect showcase for this heart-pounding reality, with a team's fortunes waning .

title: USMNT player ratings: 9/10 Reyna impresses in return
content: Mauricio Pochettino recalls Gio Reyna into his squad for friendlies against paraguay and Uruguay . he was making his first start since July 2024 . in the 10th minute, Alex Arce leveled the scoreline through a headed effort of his own .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mariners re-sign Naylor in winter's first big move
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if there was an award for free agent prediction most to likely come true, Josh Naylor returning to the Seattle Mariners would have been the front-runner .

title: NFL Week 11's fashionable arrivals, featuring Eagles WR DeVonta Smith
content: pregame tunnel outfits matched the energy of the matchups . varsity and leather jackets show up alongside lighter layers, hoodies, graphic tees and lighter layers . from lowkey tunnel walks to full-on runway moments, week 11 offers a complete style showcase .

title: ☔ 'Game blouses': Bears' jab at Vikes tops trolls
content: the Chicago Bears defeated the Minnesota Vikings 19-17 . the Bears now have five games-winning drives in the fourth quarter . they are tied for the most in a season by a Bears quarterback since the 1970 merger .

title: Bihar elections: With NDA sweep, number of M-Y MLAs hits a low
content: NDA now boasts more Yadav MLAs than the MGB . the decline in the M-Y block has seen a corresponding rise in mLAs . abysmal failure to expand its support base meaningfully beyond its traditional Muslim-Yadave base .

title: Delhi blast: 'Madam Surgeon' emerges as key player; diaries reveal planned 'D-6 Mission'
content: When not covering crime, he reads fiction, roams around the dark alleys of the city in the dead of night. An MA (English Litt) from University of Lucknow, Pathikrit loves to speak French, well at least a smattering of it. He did his graduation in French language. A recipient of the Road Safety Fellowship of the United Nations, Pathikrit drives cautiously and advises others to do that too. Read More

title: Declared dead by officials, UP woman fights to come alive
content: the 58-year-old woman has been making rounds of govt offices pleading that she is alive since she received her own death certificate instead of her husband's three years ago . the clerical error by the Chamar Nagaria gram panchayat office in Khair block of Aligarh district has put Saroj Devi in a spot .

title: Rudra may change how Army operates: Upgrade likely from ‘Cold Start’ to ‘Cold Strike’ doctrine
content: 'Rudra' all-arms brigade under the 12 Konark’ Corps was 'fully validated operationally' during the Akhand Prahar’ drills in the desert sector under the just-concluded Trishul exercise . doctrinal evolution has gained ground after southern Army Command chief lt-general said performance of the brigades under the 'Konark' Corps was "fully valid operationally"

title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, actor Ajith Kumar get bomb threat
content: veteran journalist has over 31 years of experience in crime reporting across leading Tamil and English newspapers . he has covered historic events including the deaths of former Tamil Nadu Chief Ministers Jayalalithaa and M. Karunanidhi, the IPL betting scam and the Kanchi Seer Sankararaman murder case .

title: Blackbuck deaths at Belagavi mini zoo rise to 29; probe widens
content: eight blackbucks died on Thursday, followed by 20 more on Saturday . preliminary postmortem findings point to an outbreak of Hemorrhagic Septicemia (HS) a highly contagious bacterial infection known to spread rapidly among herbivores . experts say sudden temperature drop to 13°C appears to have triggered spike in bacterial activity .
